I don't think any reasonable person here is disputing the seriousness. I think it's much worse than the mainstream news reports, and don't personally believe a word of the official statistics. It's very clear that sick people are being sent away from hospitals (particularly in Wuhan) without any testing or confirmation. The medical community is overwhelmed and only working with the most serious cases right now, until reinforcements and supplies are in place. Do all of these people have coronavirus? Maybe not, but a goodly many of them do. My secret Chinese Statistic Washamatic Formula for getting to the real numbers tells me there are probably 75,000-100,000 infections right now. Some of them milder or moderate, but most if not all capable of spreading contagion. Deaths aren't properly being recorded either, but I'm sure it is more than the 80 they are reporting, and will go higher. But it certainly isn't as virulent as SARS or we'd be seeing a lot worse by now, and it isn't Ebola. I think what many people here are becoming irritated with is the strident, almost manic presentation, sometimes multiple times per hour and across threads, of at least one and maybe two forum members. There is an element of creepiness in that these poster(s) are trying to purposely incite panic and are thrilled to be doing so. Panic helps nobody, anywhere. Sorry, but that's how their tone comes off to me---thrilled at disaster, under the guise of providing a "public information service." It doesn't help that the TA forum format is inherently disorganized and improperly moderated.Edited: 12:53 am, January 27, 2020
